keyPolicies.policyDescription: Every home in Wolverhampton can now receive a 'Homespack' and assistance with planning and home improvement projects. We will address planning and building issues decisively and we can tackle areas of deprivation in our city.

mentions.candidate: Paul Uppal is campaigning to replace the number of MPs, cut Whitehall, and rebalance city and town economies. He's a local man with six years as a senior lecturer before he decided to become an MP. As an MP, he cut expenses by a third and fought for change.

issues.education: Paul Uppal is campaigning to refurbish the crumbling two schools and put teachers in the power to end discipline issues and ensure kids get a good quality education.
issues.governance: Paul is campaigning to cut the number of MPs, cut Whitehall, and rebalance city and town economies where taxpayers see where their money is spent. It’s time for change.
issues.immigration: My family came from Kenya. My view on immigration is that yes, we want a positive contribution, but people also want to feel they have control; that they are contributing to the UK. It’s just common sense. -The Guardian - 20 March

housing.content: Every home in Wolverhampton can now receive a 'Homespack' and assistance with planning and home improvement projects. We will address planning and building issues decisively and we can tackle areas of deprivation in our city.

politicalExperience.achievements: Cut expenses by a third, fought for change.

contactInformation.address: Wolverhampton Conservatives, Carver Building, Needles Lane, Wolverhampton WV1 1QQ
